title: Bolsonaro Arrested in Brasilia After Alleged Escape Plot and Tampered Ankle Moni

Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police over flight risk Reuters
A judge said he ordered the arrest after learning Bolsonaro’s ankle monitor had been tampered with. The Trump ally was convicted earlier this year of attempting a military coup.
The arrest came days before the former president was expected to be ordered to begin a 27-year prison sentence for staging a failed coup.

Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal police custody on Saturday before a planned supporters' vigil near his home, ending months of house arrest as he appealed a Supreme Court conviction for plotting a coup.

title: Lost Security Key Blocks Access to Election Vote Tally
snippets: A global group of researchers was unable to read the vote tally, after an official lost one of three secret code keys needed to unlock a hyper-secure election system.
Voting system required three keys. One of them has been "irretrievably lost."
titles: Cryptology Group Held an Election, but Can’t Decrypt the Results
Oops. Cryptographers cancel election results after losing decryption key.
summary: A group of researchers could not access the vote tally from a hyper-secure election system because one of the three required secret code keys was lost by an official. With the key "irretrievably lost," the system cannot be unlocked, and the vote results remain inaccessible.

title: Trump Exempts Brazilian Coffee and Beef From 40% Tariff Hike After Talks
snippets: Lula Stares Down Trump and Scores Tariff Victory for Brazil Bloomberg.com
In an executive order, Trump exempted dozens of Brazilian food products, including coffee and beef, from the 40% increased tariffs he had imposed.
titles: Lula Stares Down Trump and Scores Tariff Victory for Brazil - Bloomberg.com
Lula stares down Trump and scores tariff victory for Brazil
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has issued an executive order exempting several Brazilian food products, such as coffee and beef, from a 40% tariff increase. This move follows negotiations with Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva and is considered a trade victory for Brazil. The exemptions take effect immediately.
